column4: dpkg -r|--remove | -P|--purge <package name> ... | -a|--pending
operative@serenity:~$ boxy esd can stop it loading if something is broken with sound
take esd out of the gnome startup process and try again

doesnt matter

no
so what should i try? or do you have a link?
sound could be coming through esd / artsd (kde) / alsa / oss(emulation)
when its taking ages to boot, drop to another terminal, run top and see whats going on
or pstree gdm
esd is running in top is that good?
wont hurt anything if you kill it, see if your boot speeds up when you do

dont know really, just watch top, see if anything is maxing out
